resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

worklogs.comment:
fsaintjacques commented on pull request #6259: ARROW-7640: [C++][Dataset][Parquet] Detect missing compression support
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6259
 
 
   The following patch ensures that reading a dataset with unspported parquet files does not crash. It also detects the missing files so it can still work with other files.
   
   If any of the ColumnChunk compression is not supported, the whole file is ignored.
   
   Also fix an uncaught exception in parquet::arrow::reader::GetReader.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

pitrou commented on issue #6259: ARROW-7640: [C++][Dataset][Parquet] Detect missing compression support
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6259#issuecomment-577614001
 
 
   > It also skips such file, instead of failing mid-scan
   
   Is that desirable? This sounds like very unexpected behavior, and may lead the user into ignoring parts of a dataset without realizing.

fsaintjacques commented on issue #6259: ARROW-7640: [C++][Dataset][Parquet] Detect missing compression support
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6259#issuecomment-577788295
 
 
   The this eviction is done in FileSystemSourceFactory at discovery time and is controllable via [FileSystemFactoryOptions.exclude_invalid_files](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/26065ee606d2eafba5fd3582100c19b5c518a891/cpp/src/arrow/dataset/discovery.h#L112-L117). My opinion is that non-deterministic failure in mid-scan is much worse.
   
   In practice, I suspect that all ColumnChunk are compressed with the same codec, thus making the whole file unreadable when the compression is not baked in.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

fsaintjacques commented on issue #6259: ARROW-7640: [C++][Dataset][Parquet] Detect missing compression support
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6259#issuecomment-577788295
 
 
   The this eviction is done in FileSystemSourceFactory at discovery time and is controllable via [FileSystemFactoryOptions.exclude_invalid_files](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/26065ee606d2eafba5fd3582100c19b5c518a891/cpp/src/arrow/dataset/discovery.h#L112-L117). My opinion is that non-deterministic failure in mid-scan is much worse.
   
   In practice, I suspect that all ColumnChunk are compressed with the same codec, thus making the whole file unreadable when the compression is not baked in, thus making this change more practical than the raised issue.

My opinion is that non-deterministic failure in mid-scan is much worse.
   
   In practice, I suspect that all ColumnChunk are compressed with the same codec, thus making the whole file unreadable when the compression is not baked in. This change is more practical than the raised issue.

fsaintjacques commented on issue #6259: ARROW-7640: [C++][Dataset][Parquet] Detect missing compression support
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6259#issuecomment-577788295
 
 
   The this eviction is done in FileSystemSourceFactory at discovery time and is controllable via [FileSystemFactoryOptions.exclude_invalid_files](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/26065ee606d2eafba5fd3582100c19b5c518a891/cpp/src/arrow/dataset/discovery.h#L112-L117). My opinion is that non-stable failure (depends on filter + selected columns) in mid-scan is much worse.
   
   In practice, I suspect that all ColumnChunk are compressed with the same codec, thus making the whole file unreadable when the compression is not baked in. This change is more practical than the raised issue.

nealrichardson commented on issue #6259: ARROW-7640: [C++][Dataset][Parquet] Detect missing compression support
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6259#issuecomment-577804095
 
 
   Does this/is it possible to communicate to the user that files are being dropped and why? Thinking back to how I encountered this issue, the segfault at least made clear that I needed to rebuild the C++ library with snappy support in order to read the files. But if they're silently ignored, I'd have done a scan and gotten 0 rows and wondered what I'd done wrong to have no rows of data, and it would have taken me forever to discover why it was because not having compression codecs built would probably be around 30th on the list of things I'd consider.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on issue #6259: ARROW-7640: [C++][Dataset][Parquet] Detect missing compression support
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6259#issuecomment-577815466
 
 
   We could have a method in SourceDiscovery that returns a `vector<Path, Status>`, one entry per file with a status if it can be read by the format.
   
   From the POV of high level implementations (R/Python), you can change the `open_source(..., force = false, ...)` function to query this new method and proceed if it is all success. In case of failure, you raise an error and suggest the user to call this method again but with `force = true` to imply this verification shouldn't be done.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on issue #6259: ARROW-7640: [C++][Dataset][Parquet] Detect missing compression support
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6259#issuecomment-577815466
 
 
   We could have a method in FileSystemSourceFactory that returns a `vector<Path, Status>`, one entry per file with a status if it can be read by the format.
   
   From the POV of high level implementations (R/Python), add the `force` option to `open_source`. The function query this new method and proceed if it is all success. In case of failure, it raise an error and suggest the user to call this method again but with `force = true` to imply this should be skipped. The net effect is that the user is warned if a file is ignored and can ignore this failure with a flag.
   
   This would be hard to plug into DatasetFactory due to heterogeneous SourceFactory, they're not all FileSystem based.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

bkietz commented on issue #6259: ARROW-7640: [C++][Dataset][Parquet] Detect missing compression support
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6259#issuecomment-577839152
 
 
   @fsaintjacques I think it'd be sufficient to allow `ParquetFileFormat` to be configurable to either ignore files with unsupported compression (as though they were just invalid files; as you've implemented) or error out at discovery time if any such parquet files are discovered, rather than return a full `vector<Path, Status>`. This can support the interactive case of explicitly ignoring files to get a query working before trying to rebuild/reacquire the library with the required codec.
   
   ```python
   >>> format = ds.ParquetFileFormat()
   >>> assert format.unsupported_compression_behavior == 'error'
   >>> factory = ds.FileSystemSourceFactory(fs, selector, format)
   >>> inspected_schema = factory.inspect()
   error: 'subdir/1/xxx/file0.parquet' has a column chunk compressed
   with Snappy, which is not available.
   >>> format.unsupported_compression_behavior = 'ignore'
   >>> factory = ds.FileSystemSourceFactory(fs, selector, format)
   >>> inspected_schema = factory.inspect()
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on issue #6259: ARROW-7640: [C++][Dataset][Parquet] Detect missing compression support
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6259#issuecomment-577842417
 
 
   I wouldn't put that in the FileFormat, but leave it in FileSystemDiscoveryOptions as it currently is. I think your proposition is good though, only we would fail at Inspect/Finish with a proper message. The difference is that we can flip the default behavior (fail by default instead of ignore).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
I was testing something out with a lighter build and built the C++ without snappy compression. Then I tried to read our sample nyc-taxi Parquet files, which turn out to be snappy compressed. Instead of a helpful error message, I got a segfault.

cc [~bkietz] [~fsaintjacques]
fields.summary: [C++][Dataset] segfault when reading compressed Parquet files if build didn't include support for codec
